```{r, printing-fuctions, echo=F}
wrap_li <- function(text = "text", fa = "fas fa-graduation-cap") {
  li <- paste0("<li><i class='fa-li ", fa, "'></i>", text, "</li>\n")
  return(li)
}

print_list <- function(text = "text", fa = "fas fa-graduation-cap") {
  open_ul  <- "<ul class='ul-edu fa-ul'>"
  close_ul <- "</ul>"
  items    <- wrap_li(text, fa)
  cat(paste0(open_ul, "\n"), items, paste0("\n", close_ul))
}
```

### Researcher | Social Scientist

<p align="justify">
I am researcher and social scientist with more than 7 years of experience storytelling with data. I love leveraging my quantitative and qualitative research toolkit to understand data, and clearly communicate  the story that data is telling to broad audiences. I especially love when the data I am working with as real-world impact. To date, my work has encompassed broad range of impact, including understanding individual differences in health outcomes,improving patient care, and patterns in the media kids consume. 

I have expertise in a variety of research skills, including surveys, interviewing, diaries, text mining, content-coding, and structural equation modeling. I use R, Python, SAS, and SPSS to accomplish data analysis and visualization. I am also a skilled communicator, and have translated data into technical articles, public interest blogs, non-profit reports, and national and international talks.

When I'm not at work, I can be found playing in local soccer, basketball, and kickball leagues. I'm also slowly working on developing a green thumb and baking through every Claire Saffitz dessert recipe.

</p>
